zone.line: 3 Fury
Thou think{'e}st we will live through thee, one by one
animal life
Like and though we can obscure not
The soul which burns within that we will dwell
Beside it, like a vain loud multitude
Vexing the self-content of wisest men --
That we will be dread thought beneath thy brain
And foul desire round thine astonished heart
thy
And blood within your labyrithine veins
Crawling like agony
X
Prometheus
Why, ye are thus now
Yet am I king over myself & rule
The torturing & conflicting throngs within
As Jove rules you when Hell grows mutinous
Chorus of Furies
From the ends of the Earth, from y ends of the Earth
Where the night has its grave & the morning its birth
Come, Come, Come
O ye who shake hills with the scream of your
mirth
